channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Why joining Trump’s ‘Board of Peace’ could be tricky for India
How ‘sleazy’ videos led to suspension of Karnataka top cop
One year of Trump 2.0: From tariffs to immigration, how US-India ties have changed
Why is Elon Musk looking to buy Irish low-cost airline Ryanair?
Timing matters: Why UAE president visited India for just 3 hours
Kabul blast: Why was a Chinese restaurant targeted by the Islamic State?
Why dismantling Ayatollah’s theocracy in Iran may not be easy
item.description: The Islamic regime for now appears to be well entrenched with no visible signs of cracks, and the end of the road is not yet in sight. However, in the opaque systems, developments are sudden without prior indications.

item.title: Why US midterm elections in 2026 spell trouble for Trump
item.description: Donald Trump is worried about the prospect of being impeached by the House of Representatives if the Republicans lose control of the House in the November 2026 Congressional elections.

item.title: How Chabahar is India’s first test of strategic resolve in 2026
item.description: Chabahar Port is not merely an infrastructure project but a symbol of India’s strategic requirements in the extended neighbourhood and a symbol of India’s strategic autonomy. India cannot afford to look weak and relent under pressure

item.title: How India-EU ties gain renewed relevance in a turbulent world
item.description: In a multipolar, interdependent world of constant global churn, India and Europe can maximise leverage by capitalising on each other’s strengths and growth potential

item.title: Turkey’s unease over Iran’s unrest: A tailwind for the next Tulip revolution?
item.description: As Iran stands at a critical crossroads, the implications extend far beyond its borders. For Turkey, the Iranian unrest is not just a regional crisis—it is a mirror reflecting its own unresolved contradictions

item.title: The Greenland shock: How Trump’s tariff threat to European allies rewrite the logic of alliance partner
item.description: The Greenland tariffs clarify a fundamental point: trade agreements derive value only insofar as they bind future policy choices. Once tariffs can be imposed at will for non-trade objectives, agreements lose their welfare-enhancing function
